POEMS

IT was a favorite project of the Pope, when he was Bishop of Perugia‚ to relieve at his own expense the scarcity of water from which the citizens of Carpineto suffered, and he accordingly had an abundant supply led down from the nearest mountain. On account of the nature of the soil, however, the springs began to fail and the supply gradually lessened until it seemed to have entirely ceased. He therefore sought another source, and the work was successfully completed on J anuary 1st, 1888—the day on which he celebrated the Golden J ubilee of his first Mass.
